New Records: Shohei Ohtani achieved a career-high 104 runs this season, surpassing his previous record of 103 set in 2021.
Shohei Ohtani is in pursuit of becoming the first major leaguer in history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 42nd homer and stole his 41st and 42nd bases.
Teoscar Hernández hit a go-ahead, three-run homer in the third inning.
Mookie Betts had an RBI single in the third inning.
Ryan O'Hearn's RBI double trimmed Baltimore's deficit to 5-4.
Anthony Banda pitched 1 1/3 innings of relief to get the victory.
Michael Kopech retired the side in the ninth for his 12th save.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani and his dog Decoy handled the ceremonial first pitch in front of a sellout crowd of 53,290.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orioles' Jorge Mateo had elbow surgery and is done for the season.
Dodgers' Jack Flaherty has a sore wrist with minimal swelling after taking a comebacker off it on Tuesday.
Dodgers' Tyler Glasnow will travel with the team to Phoenix and resume throwing Friday.
Dodgers' Yoshinobu Yamamoto will make a three-inning rehab start next week and could possibly rejoin the team.
Dodgers' Brusdar Graterol threw a 30-pitch bullpen session and will make a rehab start soon.
